children.name: shipwreck x
children.definition: shipwreck the destruction of a ship in an accident : đắm tàu
examples: survivors of the shipwreck
narrowly escaping shipwreck
the danger of shipwreck is much greater in fog.
there have been many shipwrecks along this dangerous stretch of coastline.

children.name: accident a2
children.definition: accident an event in which a car, train, plane etc is damaged and often someone is hurt :
examples: over 70,000 people are seriously injured every year in road accidents.
the accident happened at the junction of forest road and pine walk.
a train accident
a bad/serious accidentthere’s been a bad accident on the freeway.|the road is closed following a serious accident.
a major accidentnews is coming in of a major rail accident.
a horrible/nasty/horrific accidentwe narrowly avoided a nasty accident.|‘this was an absolutely horrific accident,’ said an ambulance spokesman.
a fatal accident(= in which someone is killed )a fatal accident involving a bus and a cyclist
a minor accident(= one that is not serious )the ice and poor visibility caused minor accidents all over the country.
a road/traffic accidentthe number of traffic accidents has gone down.|portugal has one of western europe’s worst road accident rates.
a car accident(alsoan automobile accidentamerican english formal)he was badly injured in a car accident.
a plane accident/an airplane accident(alsoa flying accident)holly died in a plane accident.
a rail accident/a train accidentit was the country's worst ever rail accident.
a hit-and-run accident(= when someone is hit by a driver who does not stop )a woman is fighting for her life after a hit-and-run accident.
have an accidenti had an accident on my way to work.
be involved in an accidentformal your son has been involved in a car accident.
prevent an accidentsteps have been taken to prevent a similar accident happening again.
an accident happens(alsoan accident occursformal)no one saw the accident happen.|most road accidents occur in urban areas.
an accident victimone of the accident victims is still trapped in his vehicle.
accident rates/statisticsthere is a relation between accident rates and the numbers of drivers on the road.|a survey of the latest airline accident statistics
an accident investigation/inquirythe two deaths are the subject of an accident inquiry.|accident investigations often take months.
an accident investigatoraccident investigators have been there all morning.
the scene of an accident(= the place where it happened )police were at the scene of the accident within minutes.
common errors
►do not say 'a small accident'. saya minor accident.

children.name: crash b1
children.definition: crash a serious accident in which a vehicle hits something else :
examples: forty-one people were killed in a plane crash.
crash between/with
a motorway crash between a coach and a lorry
she was involved ina head-on crashwith a motorbike
a car/train/plane etc crashhe was badly hurt in a car crash.
a road/rail/air crashthere will be an investigation into the cause of the air crash.
a head-on crash(= in which the front part of two vehicles hit each other )he died in a head-on crash with a lorry.
a fatal crash(= in which someone is killed )there have been several fatal crashes on this road.
a high-speed crashthe risk of injury from a high-speed crash
a horrific/terrible/appalling crasha horrific crash in which three teenage boys were killed
have a crash(alsobe involved in a crash) (= in a car )i’ve been nervous about driving since i had a crash last year.
a crash happens/occursthe three-vehicle crash happened on the corner of ongar road.
a crash involves somethingtwo women were taken to hospital after a crash involving a bus and a car.
a crash victim(= someone injured or killed in a crash )families of the crash victims want to know what happened.
a crash site/scene(= place where a crash happens )the authorities closed off a five-mile area around the crash site.
a crash investigator(= someone who tries to find the cause of a crash )crash investigators spent several days examining the scene.

children.name: wreck c2
children.definition: wreck us an accident in which a car or train is badly damaged :
examples: nobody could have survived the wreck.
car/train/plane wreck
my father died in a car wreck.
ben nearly died in a car wreck.

children.name: pile-up x
children.definition: pile-up a seriousroadaccident in whichmanycars or other vehicles crash into each other:vụ đâm nhau
examples: the pile-up happened in thick fog and caused a seven-mile tailback on the motorway
multiple pile-up uk a pile up involving a large number of carsvụ tai nạn nhiều xe
a multiple pile-up involving a minibus and five cars

children.name: disaster b2
children.definition: disaster a very serious accident involving atrain,plane, orship, in whichmany people are killed:thảm họa
examples: the city has emergency plans for dealing with a major disaster such as a rail crash.
air/rail disasterthảm hoạ hàng không, đường ray
at least 264 people died, in one of the worst civilian air disasters of all time.
the lockerbie disaster/the challenger disaster etc
the challenger disaster cost the lives of seven astronauts, and set back the nation’s space program for years.

children.name: collision x
children.definition: collision an accident in whichtwoormorevehicles, planes, or ships hit each other:va đụng, vụ đâu nhau
examples: collision with
a school bus has been involved in a collision with a fuel tanker.
his car was involved in a collision with a train.
mid-air collisionbetween two planes in the airva đụng trên không
the risk of a mid-air collision over central london has increased dramatically.
head-on collisionbetween two vehicles moving directly towards each other
these airbags are designed to protect car drivers in head-on collisions.
the actor was killed in a head-on collision while driving his new sports car.
two drivers were killed in ahead-oncollisionbetweena car and a taxi last night.
in collision with
the cyclist wasincollisionwitha bus.

children.name: prang x
children.definition: pranguk/ fender-benderus informala car accident in which little damage is done : tai nạn nhẹ, va chạm nhẹ
examples: atkinson was involved in a fender-bender in the hotel parking lot.
at 15, he borrowed his parents’ car and had a prang.

children.name: when a vehicle, ship etc turns over in an accident
turn over b1
children.definition: turn over /ˌtɜːʳn ˈəʊvəʳ/  if a vehicle turns over, it turns upside down, especially as a result of an accident: lật úp
examples: ▪ the car smashed into the post, turned over, and burst into flames.
▪ the train was travelling so fast that when it came off the rails it turned over onto its roof.

children.name: capsize x
children.definition: capsize if a boat capsizes, or sb/sth capsizes it, it turns over in the water: lật úp
examples: ▪ the ship capsized in rough waters with the loss of 208 lives
▪ people were fighting for places in the lifeboat, and there was a real danger of it capsizing.
▪ a huge wave struck the side of our boat, almost capsizing it.
a huge wave capsized the yacht.
when the boat capsized we were trapped underneath it.

children.name: roll over b1
children.definition: roll over/ˌrəʊl ˈəʊvəʳ/  if a vehicle or ship rolls over, it turns upside down because it is not correctly balanced:
examples: ▪ the truck jack-knifed and then rolled over.
▪ ships have stabilizers to prevent them from rolling over in rough seas.

children.name: overturn x
children.definition: overturn if a vehicle or boat overturns, or someone or something overturns it, it turns over: lật úp
examples: ▪ the truck had overturned, but the driver was not injured.
▪ the whole crew was drowned when their boat overturned in a storm.
▪ during the riots several cars were overturned and set on fire.

children.name: hit b1
children.definition: hit/hɪt/
examples: ▪ the bus hit a tree and the driver was badly injured.
▪ he pulled out of the driveway without looking, and almost hit another car.
▪ five sailors were killed when their ship hit a mine.
hit sb head-ondirectly
▪ the driver of a ford van lost control and hit another car head-on.

children.name: run over b2
children.definition: run over to hit and injure a person or animal while driving a vehicle: cán
examples: i'm afraid we've just run a rabbit over.
how can you run over a child and not stop?
be run over by sth
the boy’s dog had been run over by a car.
get run over
make sure the lights on your bike are working. i don’t want you getting run over.

children.name: crash into b1
children.definition: crash into /smash into to hit sb/sth very hard while you are driving a vehicle, making a lot of noise and causing damage:
examples: the driver lost control on a curve and crashed into a tree.
an airplane had crashed into a mountain, killing all two hundred passengers.
go crashing into something
the car skidded, then went crashing into the bus shelter.
an army helicopter smashed into the side of the mountain.

children.name: run into b2
children.definition: run into to hit something that is directly in front of you with your vehicle, especially because you are not paying attention:
examples: i turned too sharply and ran into the curb.
we almost ran into a rolls-royce that pulled out in front of us without signalling.
he ran into the car in front while he was talking on his mobile phone.
i had to brake suddenly, and the car behind ran into me.
run sth into
he ran his motorbike into a tree.

children.name: plough into x
children.definition: plough intouk /plow intous to hit a large number of vehicles or people with a vehicle, especially as a result of driving too fast, not paying attention etc: “cày” , “xới tung”
examples: the bus went out of control and ploughed into a line of traffic.
many people were injured when the train came off the rails and ploughed into the bank.
the car went out of control and ploughed into a group of people on the sidewalk.
when the driver fell asleep, the bus ploughed into a line of traffic.

children.name: collide x
children.definition: collide to hit sth or sb that is moving in a different direction from you: đâm nhau
examples: a car and a van collided on the motorway.
the two planes collided in mid-air.
an express train collided with a freight train in the morning rush hour.
collide with
i ran around the corner, and almost collided with mrs laurence.
two trainscollided head-on(= when they were moving directly towards each other ).
registerin everyday english, people usually sayrun intorather thancollide with:
her carran intothe back of a truck.

children.name: ram x
children.definition: ram to deliberately hit another boat or vehicle very hard, especially when it is not moving : tông
examples: the ship had been rammed by a submarine.
the gunmen tried to ram the police car.
in the latest raid, thieves used his van to ram a police car.
ram/slam into[] to hit sb/sth very hard while you are moving in a vehicle, especially when what you hit is not moving:
the driver had been drinking when he rammed into a car waiting at a red light.
some idiot slammed into me from behind.
he lost control of his truck and rammed into a van, killing two people.

children.name: go into x
children.definition: go into uk informal to hit sb/sth with a vehicle:
examples: someone went into the back of my bike at the traffic lights.

children.name: list x
children.definition: list (of a ship) to lean to one side, especially as a result of damage : nghiêng qua một bên
examples: the tanker is listing badly and liable to sink at any moment.
list[c]if a ship has a list, it leans to one side

children.name: have an accident a2
children.definition: have an accidentgặp tai nạn
examples: you shouldn’t go so fast on that motorcycle, you’ll have an accident!

children.name: crash b1
children.definition: crash to have a serious accident in a car, train, plane etc by violently hitting another vehicle or sth such as a wall or the ground:đâm sầm
examples: he lost control of his car at the first bend and crashed.
the plane crashed shortly after take-off.
the jet crashed after take-off.
crash into/onto etc
the plane crashed into a mountain.
crash a car/bus/plane etc
he was drunk when he crashed the car.

children.name: involved in an accident a2
children.definition: be involved in an accidentformalto have an accident - used inofficialwrittendocuments and innewsreports:gặp tai nạn
examples: if you are involved in an accident, wearing a seat belt will have the risk of death.
stolen cars are more likely to be involved in accidents.

children.name: a ship or vehicle that has been damaged
wreck c2
children.definition: wreck a car, plane, or train that has been damaged very badly, especially in a crash : xác xe
examples: he was still alive when they pulled him from the wreck.
the burned-out wrecks of two police cars littered the road.

children.name: wreck c2
children.definition: wreck/ shipwrecka ship that has sunk : xác tàu
examples: divers exploring the wreck managed to salvage some coins and jewellery.
wreck of
divers discovered the wreck of an old german warship.
